comments.author: LeGaulois
comments.body: A matrix platform is a scam. Not much different than HYIPs, except it works in a different way.So to whoever is going to advertise it here, campaign manager or campaign participants: yes sure, scams aren't moderated in the forum, but you won't be able to say you didn't know it's a scamOnly the early birds make money in such scheme

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: irsada on May 24, 2023, 12:32:22 PMThe business that works like ponzi. Referral schemes where old users get paid through new users sign upI don't think you'll be able to hire high-ranked/reputable users if that's the product you're trying to advertise. Not sure if there are any reputable campaign managers who'll take it either. If you decide to proceed then what you get is probably some spammers, plus a chance to get negative feedback since most user views ponzi as a scam (me included). CMIIW.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: irsada on May 24, 2023, 12:32:22 PMThe business that works like ponzi. That's a scam scheme. Even if you justify it that it's just "like" a ponzi and works like that then there's the obvious that it is.Quote from: irsada on May 24, 2023, 12:32:22 PMReferral schemes where old users get paid through new users sign upTypical pyramid scheme where the older users will earn from new people signing up and paying for whatever fee is being required on. There's no other way on this scheme to earn for all members but to push to refer people and have them pay the signing up fee. That business model won't stay for so long thus, it's considered as a scam. If no new members and money comes in, that's how the pyramid will collapse.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: I don't recommend Royse accepting a matrix type of project, this is an early bird type of project the ones that got in first are likely to make a profit and leave those low-level matrices to recruit on their own to make a profit, while the ones on the upper level just wait to make profits from their referrals in the lower level, there is no usage, products to promote but profit coming from recruiting people.This is a sample of the referral type of matrix

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Quote from: irsada on May 24, 2023, 12:32:22 PMThe business that works like ponzi. Referral schemes where old users get paid through new users sign upThis is an outright scam, you may be able to create a signature campaign but only members who spread spam will join you and you will end up banning the campaign from promoting after several weeks because it helps spread spam.Try to modify the system to be something useful instead of recycling customers' money and stealing other people's money.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Why do you need a promotion service when this is a referral-based project all you have to do is to pay forward big promoters or recruit them and pay their entry fee once they get in encourage them to recruit their groups or friends you don't need to hire marketers, the members are themselves the referrer.I stopped doing this kind of scheme because I was always left behind because the upper level when they recruit enough people don't do anything, there are no products involved the members are themselves the products.
